- The Senegalia montis-salinarum is a species of thorn tree native to South Africa, specifically in the Soutpansberg range in Limpopo. It is part of the "S. burkei" species complex and has a small population of around 250 adult trees. 
- Senegalia caffra, also known as hook-thorn or Acacia caffra, is a commonly occurring tree in southern Africa, including in Gauteng suburban gardens. 
- The knobthorn (Senegalia nigrescens) is a deciduous African tree found in savanna regions from West Africa to South Africa. It is resistant to drought but not frost, and its wood is resistant to termites. 
- Senegalia mellifera is a common thorn tree in Africa, known for its sweet-smelling blossoms and honey. It is also referred to as Blackthorn and Swarthaak in Afrikaans. 
- Erythrina lysistemon is a deciduous tree native to South Africa, commonly known as the common coral tree or lucky bean tree. 

Advanced information:

- The knobthorn tree, Senegalia nigrescens, plays a significant ecological role as it is browsed on by giraffes and other mammals, including elephants. 
- Senegalia mellifera is known for its pitch-black lumber when oiled, in addition to its sweet-smelling blossoms and honey.
